reviewText: This is an extrordinary biographical look at J.S. Bach (The greatest composer that ever existed). Considering that there is so little known about the man, this film is a treasure trove of imformation. Although this film has music in it, it is not a concert. Those that are looking for that should try some of the Pioneer, and Polygram / DG releases. For someone that wants to learn more about J.S. Bach, and the Bach name & heritage, you came to the right place.
summary: I can't see how anyone would NOT like this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I grew up with Mom playing classical piano on our piano downstairs, so I grew to love Bach, Brahms, Mozart and many of the other classical composers.It was really nice to learn more about Bach's past in various German cities.If you enjoy Bach's music, you should watch this biography, which also includes a variety of his music.
summary: The life of Bach was certainly amazing
Title: N/A

reviewText: Interesting different perspective on J.S.Bach's life and motivations than presented in the semi-biographical movie from France. It could've done more with his spiritual life, esp. participating in the early Reformation church in Germany.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Interesting account of the life and times of Bach. Would love to have had more of his music played but all in all a worthwhile film.
Title: N/A

reviewText: An okay biography of the most prolific of composers. I for one find a bit of Back goes a long way while many others can't get enough. The choice is yours.
